Summary of ASX Announcement (Identitii Limited - Refinancing of Corporate Funding Arrangements):

  • Refinancing: Secured $0.8M interest-free, unsecured loan from Beauvais Capital (majority shareholder, 28.7% stake).

No material timetable or capital raising details identified.

Material Information Summary (ASX: PTX) – June 2025 Activities Report & Appendix 4C

Key Highlights (Operations/Clinical Updates)

  • FDA Fast Track Designation granted for PTX-100 in relapsed/refractory mycosis fungoides (subtype of CTCL), enabling accelerated development.
  • First patient dosed in randomized Phase 2a trial for PTX-100 in CTCL (target: 40 patients across 16 global sites).
  • Cell Therapy Progress: Continued development of OmniCAR and CellPryme-M platforms, with new collaborations underway.

Financials (Appendix 4C)

  • Cash balance (30 June 2025): $6.9M (down from $10.2M in March 2025).
  • Net operating cash outflow: $3.3M (R&D/clinical spend: $2.2M).
  • Share Purchase Plan (SPP): Raised $6.8M (closed 25 July 2025).
  • Trading Halt (29 July 2025): For a follow-on Placement to professional investors.

Valuation/Capital Impact

  • Fast Track status and Phase 2a progress may enhance PTX-100’s commercial viability.
  • SPP + Placement proceeds to fund clinical trials; liquidity extended post-quarter.

Omitted: Director appointment, non-material operational details.

• Voluntary Administration: Bowen Coking Coal Ltd and 5 subsidiaries have appointed administrators due to inability to secure fresh capital or negotiate with key creditors (BUMA, QRO, senior lender).
  • Trading Status: Shares remain suspended during administration.
  • Key Reason: QRO rejected short-term royalty deferral; operational challenges from high costs, low coal prices, and higher royalties.
  • Process: Administrators aim to continue operations (including Burton Mine) while pursuing sale/recapitalisation.
  • Creditors Meeting: First meeting by 8 August 2025.

No other material information identified.

Material Information Summary – Kalamazoo Resources (ASX: KZR) – Ashburton Gold Project Update

Project & Valuation Highlights

  • Ashburton Gold Project (AGP) retained by KZR after Northern Star (NST) declines option exercise (previously held by De Grey).
  • Gold price increase: A$2,000/oz rise since February 2024 (A$3,100/oz → ~A$5,100/oz).
  • Mineral Resource: 1.44Moz Au (16.2Mt @ 2.8g/t), with 75% at Mt Olympus (re-optimized open-pit: 772,000oz @ 2.53g/t).
  • Scoping Study: Fast-tracked for Q4 2025; evaluating optimal development pathway (open-pit/flotation). Key consultants appointed.

Capital & Funding

  • Placement: A$2M raised from major shareholders/directors.
  • Use: Scoping Study acceleration + working capital.
  • Cash Position: A$5.7M (pro forma post-placement).

Key Catalysts

  • Q4 2025: Scoping Study completion, potential PFS commencement.
  • Exploration Upside: Brownfield extensions (Mt Olympus, Peake, Zeus deposits) + regional targets.

Peer Comparison

  • Undervalued vs. peers: EV/resource oz notably lower than ASX gold developers (see Annexure A).
